description: National Geographic: Explore VR is a VR exploration game in which the player explores exotic locations. The base game features a single location to explore: Antarctica. Through three different activities (kayaking, ice climbing and sheltering during a storm) the player is tasked with finding a lost penguin colony. During the activity the player can take photographs of the environment and animal encounters. Multiple photo challenges are included which reward trophies in the lodge which serves as a main menu. All the photos in the lodge can also be viewed and put on the wall or shared with Facebook. Further locations are added through DLC.
title: National Geographic: Explore VR

description:
Time Stall is a VR puzzle game in which the player must try to save the robotic crew of the Fantastic Leap spacecraft from various hazards while time has been stalled to a near standstill.

The Earth is doomed due to pollution but the player has a ticket to board the crowd funded luxury escape craft the Fantastic Leap. On board however not everything turns out to be as luxurious as it appears. When a solar flare sends the crew haywire it's up to the player to make sure the captain does not get hurt by the many ways things can go wrong on a poorly funded spacecraft.

The player can interact with all objects in the environment, from champagne bottles which can be turn into self propelled rockets and floppy slices of pizza to hockey sticks and batteries. Everything must be utilized to save the Captain, his basic obedient bots and to solve the many optional challenges.
title: Time Stall

description:
Coaster Combat is a VR roller coaster game that distinguishes itself from other roller coaster games with randomized tracks and a collection element. The Quest version of Coaster Combat is expanded from the earlier releases on Gear VR and Oculus Go. There are more themes to choose from: Volcanic Valley, Cursed Castle, Pirate Paradise, Himalaya Heights and the new Neon Night. All tracks are included in the base game unlike the earlier version which required separate purchases.

Gameplay remains mostly identical in that the player needs to hit collectibles along the track. The track pieces also have random events, enemies and collectibles making each ride different. Based on the number of collectibles hit in a ride the player is scored and can receive a medal. New is that now the player can dual wield with two weapons in a full six degrees of freedom interaction for both hands. Each track can now be played in two different difficulty modes (easy and hard) and a free ride mode which forgoes the "combat" part by removing the collectibles and enemy attacks. The power-up that spawns additional collectibles that was previously only available in Himalaya Heights is now available in all themes.

The Gold Rush mechanic already present in the earlier releases of the game, is now enhanced in an unlockable game mode. In this mode the player is presented with random rides of hard difficulty and must get a gold medal to continue the streak. Scores for Gold Rush and individual tracks can be compared with Oculus friends and local accounts which can be created in-game. Getting high streaks unlocks golden skins for the various weapons and carts that the player uses in the different themes.
title: Coaster Combat

alternate_titles.title: Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy's Edge - Enhanced Edition

title: Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy's Edge

description: Teasing Master Takagi-san VR 1st & 2nd Semesters is a compilation of Teasing Master Takagi-san VR - 1st Semester and Teasing Master Takagi-san VR - 2nd Semester and is the first release for Oculus Quest.
title: Teasing Master Takagi-san VR 1st & 2nd Semesters

description:
Jurassic World: Aftermath - Part 2 is DLC for and the continuation of Jurassic World: Aftermath. Originally envisioned as a single game, remote work following the COVID-19 pandemic influenced development and rather than delaying the entire game, it was split up to release the first part and postpone the rest as this second part as commercial DLC nine months later.

Part 2 continues the main game and concludes the storyline with the real ending, as the ending of the first part was originally meant to occur at a different point in the game. The expansion takes about two hours to complete and opens up the remaining two doors from the five available at the island's facility. New areas include Dr. Henry Wu’s office and a secret vault deep beneath the facility. The main gameplay is identical. There are several new mini-games and dinosaur interactions.

The delay made it possible to add more content, as a second T. rex encounter that was originally envisioned as a cut-scene, was turned into an interactive encounter instead. Actors such as Jeff Goldblum and Laura Bailey reprised their roles for this second part.
title: Jurassic World: Aftermath - Part 2

description: Slimeball! is a competitive, tabletop mixed reality game with an emphasis on expressive characters and natural interactions. Players compete to feed Squelch by shooting slimeballs, items, and other surprises into their mouth for points and bonuses.
title: Slimeball!

description: Shock Troops is a retro-inspired VR shooter. The player visits a diverse array of planets as part of the Shock Troops, a kind of space reaction force to top priority and covert incidents. The Shadow Bureau has cloned an alien lifeforce they found, the player must stop them from using them to the fullest over 4 missions split into 4 level each. The halloween campaign adds another mission of 4 levels, with a more horror vibe.
title: Shock Troops

alternate_titles.title: The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners - Aftershocks: Tourist Edition

description:
The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners - Tourist Edition is the default version of The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners. Unlike the Windows (Rift) and PlayStation 4 versions, the default version consists of the base game and DLC, not available separately:

  • The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners (base game)
  • The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners - Tourist Edition (DLC)
title: The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners - Tourist Edition
Wallace & Gromit in The Grand Getaway
Just Dance VR: Welcome to Dancity

description: Batman: Arkham Shadow is a VR game set in the Arkhamverse. It takes place between Arkham Origins and Arkham Asylum and follows Batman as he tries to stop the villain Rat King and his gang from destroying Gotham on the Fourth of July. It was a pack-in title for the Meta Quest 3 and 3S models on their launch, until April 30, 2025.
title: Batman: Arkham Shadow
